required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dual Add-on Therapy in Type 2 Diabetes Poorly Controlled With Metformin Monotherapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Parallel Group, Phase 3 Trial to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Retagliptin Plus Henagliflozein Added to Metformin Compared to Retagliptin or Henagliflozein in Combination With Metformin in Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Alone

brief_summary.textblock: 2 weeks screening period, 4 weeks run-in period, 24 weeks double-blind treatment period, to evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Retagliptin Plus Henagliflozein added to Metformin compared to Retagliptin or Henagliflozein in combination with Metformin in Subjects with Type 2 Diabetes who have Inadequate Glycemic Control on Metformin Alone

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Mean change from baseline in HbA1c at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: • To compare the mean change from baseline in HbA1c achieved with concurrent addition of Retagliptin Plus Henagliflozein to metformin vs the addition of Retagliptin or Henagliflozein to metformin after 24 weeks of double-blind treatment.
